Legal_Issue: Whether the ministerial representative erred in law by concluding that taxpayer relief provisions did not permit penalty cancellation
Governing_Law: Subsection 220(3.1) of the Income Tax Act
Application_Facts: Applicant faced penalties due to a tax preparer's error
Decision_Outcome: Decision is set aside and referred for redetermination to a different delegate
Defendant_Behavior: CRA decision maker treated guidelines as binding
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Application_Basis: Request for penalty cancellation based on taxpayer relief provisions
Governing_Rule: Discretion to waive penalties/interest under subsection 220(3.1)
Outcome: Decision overturned, case remitted for reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Unfair imposition of penalties due to third-party error
Cause_Description: Penalties imposed due to tax preparer's error; relief denied based on erroneous view that guidelines were binding

Decision_Rationale: Guidelines are non-binding; decision maker failed to exercise discretion properly
